Description: Green glazed steatite scarab; clypeus marked; back worn; longitudinally pierced; representation of king and sphinx and prenomen and epithet of Thutmose III on base.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1913 / Catalogue of Egyptian scarabs, etc. in the British Museum (1057)
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Thutmose III
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev George Rivers Hunter
